PostgreSQL vs MySQL

The following are a list of advantages and disadvantages of PostgreSQL when compared to MySQL.
Advantages Disadvantages
  • Don't have to lock a table to change it
  • Good at subqueries
  • Can add multiple indexes
  • Supports replication
  • Nested tables
  • Better support in geo Search
  • Uses check constraint
  • Supports many default values
  • Enforces foreign key constraints
  • Less common
  • More cryptic command syntax
  • Similar to Oracle, a lot of people with an Oracle background use it
  • Only supports a couple types of partitioning (range and list)
  • Not as much user support because it's not as popular
Overall, PostgreSQL is more complex but also has more functionality. Click here to get back to the Overview Page.
